image.altText: Headshot photo of Bill Hayden in 1962.

items.synopsis: Once described as the greatest man never to become prime minister, Bill Hayden surrendered a shot at the top job for the sake of Labor Party unity.

title.children: Bill Hayden, former governor-general and Labor luminary, dies aged 90

image.altText: A satellite image shows an aerial view of the Rafah border crossing

items.synopsis: In a post to X, the US Embassy in Israel said the Gaza-Egypt border may open at 10am local-time on Saturday, allowing foreign nationals to leave the besieged Palestinian enclave. Follow live.

title.children: US embassy says Rafah crossing may open for foreign citizens to leave Gaza soon

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) repatriation flight bringing almost 100 people out of Israel has touched down in Perth, just after midday local time, with almost all passengers being transferred to flights heading to Melbourne and Sydney. There were approximately 99 passengers on board the aircraft, which arrived from Dubai. It follows a flight from Tel Aviv to Dubai with 99 passengers on board. In a post today on X, formerly Twitter, Foreign Affairs Minister Penny Wong said more than 1,800 previously registered Australians had now left Israel and the occupied Palestinian territories, including the West Bank. Today's aircraft is understood to be the final Australian government-assisted flight out of Israel for the foreseeable future. Only about six of the 99 passengers were returning home to Perth, according to Perth Airport.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: RAAF repatriation flight touches down in Perth

children.content: A Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) repatriation flight bringing almost 100 people out of Israel has touched down in Perth, just after midday local time, with almost all passengers being transferred to flights heading to Melbourne and Sydney.
There were approximately 99 passengers on board the aircraft, which arrived from Dubai.
It follows a flight from Tel Aviv to Dubai with 99 passengers on board.
In a post today on X,
formerly Twitter, Foreign Affairs Minister Penny Wong said
more than 1,800 previously registered Australians had now left Israel and the occupied Palestinian territories, including the West Bank.
Today's aircraft is understood to be the final Australian government-assisted flight out of Israel for the foreseeable future.
Only about six of the 99 passengers were returning home to Perth, according to Perth Airport.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The US Embassy in Israel said the Gaza-Egypt border may open today, suggesting that such a move would enable foreign citizens to leave the besieged Palestinian enclave. In a post to X, the embassy said it had "received info" that the crossing would open at 10am on Saturday (6pm AEDT) but was not sure how long it would remain open for foreign citizens to depart. Twenty trucks carrying aid are waiting to cross the Egyptian border into Gaza once the crossing opens. You can read more about the Rafah border crossing here .
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: US embassy says Rafah crossing may open for foreign citizens to leave Gaza soon

children.content: The US Embassy in Israel said the Gaza-Egypt border may open today, suggesting that such a move would enable foreign citizens to leave the besieged Palestinian enclave.
In a post to X, the embassy said it had "received info" that the crossing would open at 10am on Saturday (6pm AEDT) but was not sure how long it would remain open for foreign citizens to depart.
Twenty trucks carrying aid are waiting to cross the Egyptian border into Gaza once the crossing opens.
You can
read more about the Rafah border crossing here

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: More than 500 people rallied in downtown Brisbane this afternoon and then marched through the city streets, showing their support for the Palestinian people. Draped in Palestinian flags and colours, they chanted in unison for more than an hour, "Free, free Palestine," and "End the siege". Event speakers condemned the Australian government's support of Israel and called for a ceasefire in Gaza saying thousands of innocent people have been killed and injured. Fourteen-year-old Ghena Bader was born in Gaza and says she has many relatives still there, who are now fearing for their lives. “It’s sad for them and for us. You’re calling them now but next time you call, they might be dead,” said Ms Bader. “I’ve lived through many wars and it’s difficult and sad. I feel bad for the children, they don’t deserve to live on the streets without food, water or electricity." More than 4,100 Palestinians and 1,400 Israelis have been killed in the latest conflict according to the most recent United Nations figures .
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Hundreds gather for pro-Palestinian rally in Brisbane

children.content: More than 500 people rallied in downtown Brisbane this afternoon and then marched through the city streets, showing their support for the Palestinian people.
Draped in Palestinian flags and colours, they chanted in unison for more than an hour, "Free, free Palestine," and "End the siege".
Event speakers condemned the Australian government's support of Israel and called for a ceasefire in Gaza saying thousands of innocent people have been killed and injured.

props.alt: A large group of people gather in King George Square outside City Hall in Brisbane

children.content: The rally took place in King George Square on Saturday.
(ABC News: Michelle Tapper)
Fourteen-year-old Ghena Bader was born in Gaza and says she has many relatives still there, who are now fearing for their lives.
“It’s sad for them and for us. You’re calling them now but next time you call, they might be dead,” said Ms Bader.
“I’ve lived through many wars and it’s difficult and sad. I feel bad for the children, they don’t deserve to live on the streets without food, water or electricity."
More than 4,100 Palestinians and 1,400 Israelis have been killed in the latest conflict
according to the most recent United Nations figures
